content.description:
Climb up and right to an arete past 6 bolts and finish with a cool slabby mantle.  Mostly easier climbing with a couple crux moves around the 4th and 5th bolts.

There are some large loose blocks but the climbing is solid.
content.location: This route goes up a small block to the right of Buried Treasure to the arete.

climbs.name: Right for Life
climbs.fa: John Hartman, Gabe Acosta, Merlin Fortner - 1992

content.description:
The start looks chossy, but it is great fun.  Start up a corner past three bolts to a loose pillar.

Clip the fourth bolt from the top of the pillar and then think about the route name for a minute or two.  Easy runnout after the sixth bolt to the anchor.
content.location: This climb starts just left around the arete from Buried Treasure.

climbs.name: Nicely Displayed But Wrappers Weren't Included
climbs.fa: John Hartman, Gabe Acosta, Bill Trethewey - 1990

content.description:
Great route name!  This route offers good slippery off vertical face climbing up a shady face.  Climbing over the river is way cool.

The first two bolts seemed way left of the best holds and a harder finish 5.10c going left to the 8th bolt make the route feel a little contrived.

Good luck pulling your rope and not getting it soaked!
content.location: This is the obvious left most route heading out sharply left over the river from a large easy dihedral.

climbs.name: Life in Electric Larvae Land
climbs.fa: John Hartman, Gabe Acosta, Merlin Fortner 1992

content.description:
A fun arete route with tricky route finding to keep the grade at 5.10b above the 6th bolt.

There is water at the base of this route and quite a bit of bird poo but it really didn't seem like an issue compared to the good climbing on the route.
content.location: This route starts up an easy flake and right facing corner to the first bolt, crack face and arete above, just left of Left for Dead.

content.description:
This is a crimpy steep climb that stays on from the first bolt to the bird poo covered slabby ledge at the end.

Sport bolted in typical Louie Anderson style, Go Big!
content.protection: 6 bolts - lower off.  Don't flub the 3rd clip!
content.location: This route starts up the steep face between Right to Life and Life in Electric Larvae Land.

content.description: Start up the easy corner to some good climbing in the corner until the bolts wander left up the steep bulge - a little contrived but forget about it and have fun.
content.protection: 8 bolts - lower off.  Fist bolt is up a ways on easy climbing.
content.location: This route starts in the large bushy corner right of Nicely Displayed.

content.description:
This is a long sustained line on a narrow face with a left facing corner on the right and an arete on the left.  The holds are a little slippery with engaging moves on an off vertical face.

The bolts weave back and forth a couple times making the climb feel a little contrived.

There is the stump of a chopped down tree at the base you don't want to fall on before the first bolt.

The route is a bit flooded, but easily climbed/belayed.
content.location: This route is to the right of Right for Life and follows the thin face between the arete and the corner.
